meanings.definition: To cover or hang with cloth in loose folds
meanings.sent1: She decided to drape the blanket over the couch.
meanings.sent2: The curtains drape beautifully over the window.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat tried to drape itself in the tablecloth.
meanings.sent4: The fog seemed to drape the entire city in a mysterious veil.
meanings.sent5: The artist carefully draped the fabric to create a stunning display.

meanings.definition: A piece of cloth arranged in loose folds
meanings.sent1: She picked up the elegant drape and admired its texture.
meanings.sent2: The luxurious drape added a touch of elegance to the room.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy got tangled in the long drape.
meanings.sent4: The drape of the flag fluttered proudly in the wind.
meanings.sent5: The soft drape felt comforting against her skin.

meanings.definition: To arrange in flowing lines or folds
meanings.sent1: The designer wanted to drape the fabric to create a unique look.
meanings.sent2: The dress drape gracefully around her figure.
meanings.sent3: The wind seemed to playfully drape the tree branches together.
meanings.sent4: The sunlight began to drape the landscape in a warm glow.
meanings.sent5: She carefully draped the scarf around her neck for warmth.
